physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Acute respiratory distress and posturing developed 14 hours postoperatively; the patient had a seizure.
Magnetic resonance imaging confirmed extensive infarction in the posterior fossa with sparing of the brainstem; herniation of the cerebellar contents and compression of the brainstem.

Three-view cervical spine radiographic series showed no evidence of fracture or subluxation; questionable calcific density superior to the posterior arch of C1 indicated the possibility of an arcuate foramen.
